New Records: Framber Valdez came within one out of a no-hitter for the second time this season
Key Match Events: Jose Altuve rocketed a double off the wall in left field to score Jake Meyers and send the Astros to a dramatic, 3-2, walk-off win over the Royals
Paul DeJong tied the game with a two-run homer in the top of the ninth off Houston closer Josh Hader
Bryan Abreu gave up a two-out single to pinch-hitter Kyle Isbel in the eighth inning to break up the no-hit bid
Pre-Game Insights: Manager Joe Espada emphasized the importance of strong bullpen performance
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Joe Espada expressed pride in Framber Valdez's performance
Jose Altuve reflected on the importance of Jake Meyers getting on base and giving the team the opportunity to score a run
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Astros have had five no-hit bids of at least seven innings this year, which ties the 1989 Rangers and 1965 Reds for the most in one season in the expansion era (since 1961)
